description.value:
Picturing something that you've seen or imagined, you wave your hand and use your magic to visualize it within the world itself.
You can do one of the following:

  • Create up to three simple illusions that fit within 1 square foot. So long as you can see the illusory object unobstructed, then you can re-form the image as a minor action, or move it up to a total of 30 feet per round, shared between each of your illusory objects, as a free action.
    • Simple illusions do not have intricate carvings, textures, or multiple parts. A pocket watch might be a simple illusion, but no gears could be showing and it might lack a chain or any intricate designs.
  • Create one complex illusion that fits within 5 square feet. So long as you can see the illusory object unobstructed, then you can re-form the image as an action, or move it up to a total of 15 feet per round as a minor action.


    These illusory objects cannot give off light, sound, smell, or any other sensory effect, and are revealed as illusions when physically interacted with since objects pass through them. If a creature examines an illusion, it can succeed in determining that it’s an illusion with a successful Intelligence (Investigation) check against your Spell Save DC. Reduce the Spell Save DC by 3 for this roll if the illusory object is complex. Attempting to simulate living creatures causes it to appear obviously illusory without the need to make a check.
